Title: Digital Marketing Manager - Oakville, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
7 Communications is a luxury lifestyle and branding agency that creates communications strategies and multi-channel executions for global, national and regional brands across a multitude of categories. Our team is comprised of passionate, strategic, creative, execution-obsessed, resourceful, innovative, detail-fixated, stay-up-late-until-the-work’s-done, problem-solving humans – working together every day to create and deliver world-class outcomes for the many clients we serve.
We are currently seeking a Digital Marketing Manager. That person has a passion for solving marketing challenges through digital channels and technologies and will capitalize on the capabilities of our agency and extend them in the digital marketing realm.
What we want to see in you:
A thinker who possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and is a demonstrated self-starter.
A confident character who actively works with our leadership team and all internal teams to sell strategic, digital marketing solutions to clients.
Ambitious, open to learning and growing, and accustomed to working in a swift-moving, ever-changing environment.
A good human being.
Reporting to the Vice President, Integrated Accounts, the Digital Marketing Manager will:
· Play a key role in developing a digital mindset and a culture of innovation across the entire organization.
· Have extensive and wide-ranging marketing knowledge in building brand awareness, driving traffic to client digital channels and generating sales leads.
· Collaborate, alongside our leadership, creative and delivery teams on the development of integrated strategies and solutions to help each client stand-out and deliver against objective(s).
Design measurement frameworks and KPIs for all digital campaigns, then monitor and measure performance, leveraging expertise, insights and trends to generate data-backed optimizations.
Coordinate with advertising and media experts to improve marketing results.
· Project manage website development projects (developed with WebFlow), as needed, following an established process.
· Provide ongoing support to the leadership team on new business development opportunities and key pitches, as a digital thought leader and/or direct contributor.
Identify new cross-brand/cross-industry collaboration opportunities that help us build revenue, enhance thought leadership and increase agency visibility.
Guide in-house digital and integrated account team members.
What we are looking for on your CV, and in your arsenal of expertise:
5+ years overall industry experience with a minimum of 3 years providing strategic guidance across a diverse spectrum of client categories.
Experience and knowledge of all aspects of digital is necessary, including: paid search; display; search optimization; social media; video; web/mobile; e-commerce; CRM; analytics; and, marketing automation.
A post-secondary degree in marketing, business, communications, or equivalent professional experience.
Demonstrated ability to constantly identify and share the latest digital trends and technologies affecting our industry.
Recognized passion for developing insightful creative briefs and brainstorming innovative growth strategies
Confident and willing to challenge clients and colleagues based on proven case knowledge and experience.
Proven expertise managing multiple projects at once, with various goals, across different industries – proactively leading teams and clients to successful outcomes.
Extraordinary problem-seeing and problem-solving capabilities.
Exceptional oral and written communication and conversational skills.
Proficiency in forecasting and budget development.
Demonstrated fluency with Apple MacBook and Desktop Applications – including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, and strong insight into and aptitude for sales optimization platforms.
Attributes and skills important to us include confidence, decisiveness, timely decision-making, self-starter, integrity, persuasion, delegation, flexibility, communication, and the ability to implement strategy and execute contingency plans.
7 Communications wishes to thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Application deadline: 2021-12-22
Job Type: Full-time
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Work remotely:
Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Digital Marketing Manager - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Our client is a rapidly expanding NewSpace venture that has received huge accolades over the past few years for their innovative technology that helps with the sustainability of our planet.
Due to continued growth we are seeking a Digital Marketing Manager who can transform their digital experience worldwide. This new position plays a crucial role in building the company’s digital stack foundation, online performance, and lead generation strategy.
From exploiting and optimizing the CRM for lead management, to developing our marketing automation pipeline, and working with sales strategically to execute inbound and outbound campaigns, make the most of your digital expertise within a company recognized a Fast Company World’s Most Innovative Company for 2021.
Responsibilities
Working closely with the Marketing Director, you will develop and manage digital marketing strategies, campaigns, and content to generate leads and awareness to support the company’s growth globally.
Improve online lead generation strategies and tactics to support growing international sales groups including manage marketing automation integration in our tech stack.
Create and manage marketing automation workflows, tailor campaigns for targeted B2B audiences, including A/B testing programs.
Lead the development, management and execution of email and website landing pages, providing expertise on web best practices (SEO/SEM), relevant content and brand cohesion.
Participate in the multi-channel launch of new products, services, and our next satellites!
Responsible for the development, maintenance, and improvements of the corporate website, online content and provide recommendations to improve customer journey.
Oversee the online content strategy as well as supervising the execution of paid digital initiatives on platforms including Google AdWords and LinkedIn Ads.
Work together with our Communication and Events Specialist on digital events, social media and PR strategy related to B2B market specific campaigns.
Interact and/or manage content and digital service providers such as SEO consultants, web design agency, CRM partners, brand strategy agency, translation firm, video production, etc.
Maintain performance, measure against objectives, and proactively advise the business to adapt strategy and seize opportunities through analytics and reporting.
Profile
Advanced experience with Pardot/Salesforce
Experience managing CMS
Ability to analyze and report on Google Analytics
Experience with Google Tag Manager
Experience in implementing SEO/SEM processes and best-practices
Certified Google AdWords Specialist, asset
Your Background:
Bachelor’s degree in business administration, marketing, or commerce
+5 years experience in digital marketing role, with exposure to media planning and campaign management
B2B Marketing experience, a must
Proven track record in managing marketing campaigns: digital, content development, marketing automation, web analytics, etc.
Exceptional written and verbal storytelling skills in English, fluency in another language is considered an asset (bilingual English and French environment)
Demonstrated ability to lead projects and participate in projects with a multidisciplinary team.
Deeply collaborative and comfortable in an environment of hyper growth
Must be able to obtain government security clearance.
Reference ID: NSSR1700
Application deadline: 01/09/2021
Expected start date: 06/09/2021
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $85,000.00-$95,000.00 per year
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
COVID-19 considerations:
Hybrid working from home during COVID-19 2-3 times a week is fine.
Work remotely:
Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Director of Marketing - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Affiliate Marketing Manager - North America - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Ledn provides financial products with a mission to help clients across the globe unlock the power of digital assets to build wealth for the long term. Active in over 100 countries and exceeding $1 billion in assets on its platform, Ledn provides simple, transparent, and secure financial service products that help people save, earn, and borrow on their digital assets.
Ledn is backed by world class investors that has allowed the company to experience tremendous growth since launching in 2018. We are one of Canada’s leading digital asset companies creating a global platform. Ledn is led by a team with decades of experience in traditional financial services and banking, all connected by a common belief in the future of digital assets.
The Opportunity
As the
Affiliate Marketing Manager, North America,
you will manage and maintain Ledn’s affiliate partnership program across North America. You will build relationships with partners that generate new client growth and are thought leaders in the digital asset space. You will develop partnerships not only with leading influencers but also with prestigious media publishers, affiliate networks, content creators, and brands.You will create and design communication guidelines to maximize the impact of our partnerships and will consolidate our affiliate base designing outreach strategies to maximize affiliate acquisitions. Overall you will gain a complete understanding of the acquisition funnel and develop cutting edge marketing skills using the most up to date platforms in the industry.
About The Role
Manage the day-to-day operations of Ledn’s affiliate partnerships, including relationship management, onboarding, reporting, and technical integrations.
Serve as the primary point of contact for partners and manage all inbound and outbound collaboration requests.
Nurture, grow, and evolve existing partnerships with influencers, publications, and affiliate platforms.
Explore new opportunities to leverage affiliate partnerships including content and video collaborations, paid media, and more.
Develop and maintain a pipeline of new affiliate partners that align with Ledn’s brand/mission and that complement our full range of products.
Own the affiliate marketing budget and manage all costs, report on new member acquisition results, member engagement, and product adoption.
Monitor affiliate performance and ensure continuous growth and optimization.
Work closely with Brand, Social Media, Lifecycle Marketing, and Paid Growth teams to leverage influencer and affiliate content, ensuring programs are successful from end-to-end.
Helps to execute detailed tracking and reporting at granular levels to deep dive into optimization opportunities while maintaining strategic view.
This is a full remote role where you will work with our global marketing team on a remote basis. Must have the ability to accommodate meetings, conduct virtual meetings, attend training sessions, and collaborate in a remote world.
What You Bring To Ledn
3-4 years experience in affiliate marketing or partnership management leading the program structure of partner marketing activities including relationship management, program terms, payout, compliance, audience targeting and segmentation.
Accredited bachelor's degree in business, marketing, advertising, or a related field required.
Experience in planning and forecasting expense, revenue, profitability, and customer growth.
Knowledgeable in Google Analytics.
Experience working with affiliate management platforms such as Impact or Partnerize.
Knowledge of the financial services and crypto landscape in North America.
The ability to promptly, professionally and thoughtfully manage partner needs and requests in a fast-paced and changing environment.
Comfortable negotiating commission rates and forming relationships with advertisers.
Collaborative, enthusiastic, and adaptable attitude.
Work independently in performance-driven environment.
Skilled writer, negotiator, and relationship builder.
Ability to work cross functionally with Product, Analytics, Accounting and Technology teams to accomplish business objectives.
Nice To Have
Experience in content and/or video production considered an asset.
Well-networked with connections in the industry and existent portfolio of influencers relationships.
Experience working at an affiliates agency.
Familiarity with affiliate marketing networks, proven record in negotiation and management of online media campaigns.
A Taste of What We Provide
As one of Canada’s leading digital asset companies we provide tremendous growth opportunities.
Flexible working environments.
A career that provides you with purpose in your job. We remove barriers so you love what you do.
Team-based organizational structures that reinforce problem solving, decision making, and collaboration.
Here at Ledn we all have ownership in the company.
Comprehensive benefits package that starts on your first day with us.
Competency based compensation structures.
We are an equal opportunity employment organization and pride ourselves on inclusivity, diversity, and the success that comes from diversity. Please check us out on LinkedIn to get to know the team. Please reach out to the Ledn Talent team here for any accommodations for applying and for participating in the interview process.
Please note,
due to the high volume of applications, only those applicants that qualify will be contacted.
It's COVID, where are you working?
We're all working remote until Dec 2021. After that, if and when it's safe to do so, we will be offering flexible working environments of remote and in-office, which is located downtown Toronto and Montreal. We've learned a lot working remotely and are pretty good at it, but also miss connecting and collaborating with our team!

Title: Marketing Operations Manager - Remote - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Marketing Analytics Manager
*
Position Overview*
As a key member of the Marketing team, the Marketing Analytics Manager will be responsible for gathering and analyzing data, making recommendations and ensuring appropriate adjustments are made to improve our overall marketing efforts. This role will report to the Marketing Director.
Flexibility and agility are at the core of what drives Direct Travel forward and keeps our clients ahead even during unprecedented times. We need someone who can embrace this role and join a team focused on providing value to prospects and customers by crafting the DT experience and expanding our digital marketing strategy.
*
Responsibilities*
*
Identify scalable ways of extracting, managing and analyzing marketing data.
Synthesize automated reports that expose opportunities to improve marketing KPI’s
Through metric monitoring, identify data anomalies and/or patterns to uncover areas of improvement for the online user experience
Mine and analyze data sets that yield opportunities for revenue and process improvements
Build intuitive presentations, reports, dashboards, infographics and/or visualizations that communicate a data-driven narrative through actionable insights
Utilize HubSpot to execute lead conversion strategies, move leads through the sales funnel via intuitive nurturing workflows and flag sales-ready behavior
Build emails, landing pages and blog posts through HubSpot
Build custom lists for targeted campaigns, keep content organized and update lists, export data from our CRM into our marketing platform
Analyze campaign results to benchmark and improve cost-per-conversion rates
Work in collaboration with sales to streamline lead hand-off and improve MQL opportunity rates (SQL conversions)
Audit current systems & processes to ensure all systems and data collection processes are set up properly
Plan, execute, and measure experiments and conversion tests
Optimize external-facing touch points, such as dt.com analytics to improve conversions
Provide tools and materials to enable the sales and account management teams to function
Collaborate with agencies and other vendor partners
*
Basic Qualifications*
Degree in marketing or a related discipline
Minimum 3 years of experience in marketing
Background in data analytics and experience developing reports and dashboards
Advanced technical expertise in the following systems:
HubSpot, Salesforce, Google Analytics and Google Search (certifications preferred)
Strategic thinker, analytical and detail-oriented with advanced problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to present actionable insights through data-driven results
Proficient knowledge of contemporary marketing database technologies and best practices
Time management skills to tackle numerous projects at once in a fast-paced environment
Ability to work from home
Experience in the business travel industry
Positive, proactive individual and cross-functional partner who can easily collaborate with the team and other departments
Must be able to lawfully work within the US or Canada and have unrestricted work authorization for US or Canada
*
Preferred Qualifications*
Familiarity with Hubspot, Salesforce, Excel, Smartsheet and Google Analytics
*
About Direct Travel*
Our growing company relies on excellence to deliver on our commitments to our customers. This starts with our employees. Our inclusive culture encourages entrepreneurial spirit empowering employees to build strong, long-lasting relationships with our customers and deliver innovative solutions.
Direct Travel is one of the most respected travel management companies providing our customers with smart consultation, tailored solutions and a true partnership. Our specific focus on the mid-market means our travel experts deliver personalized service to
every
client.
Visit
www.dt.com
for more info. Follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.
_
Direct Travel is an EOE/AA/Veteran/People with Disabilities employer._
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Senior Director Marketing (Head of Marketing - Canada) - Mississauga, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Conagra Brands is one of North America's leading branded food companies. We have a rich heritage of making great food, and a team that’s passionate about innovation and growth. Conagra offers choices for every occasion through iconic brands, such as Hunts, Aylmer, Marie Callender's®, Healthy Choice®, Slim Jim®, VH Sauces, Pogo and Vlasic®, and emerging brands, including Angie's® BOOMCHICKAPOP®, Duke's®, Earth Balance®, Gardein®, and Frontera®.
We pride ourselves on having the most impactful, energized and inclusive culture in the food industry. For more information, visit www.conagrabrands.ca .
Conagra Brands est une des principales entreprises d’aliments de marque en Amérique du Nord. Son histoire est jalonnée de grands succès alimentaires qui sont le fruit du travail d’une équipe passionnée par l’innovation et la croissance. Conagra offre des choix pour toute occasion grâce à des marques réputées comme Hunt’s® , Aylmer®, Marie Callender's®, Healthy Choice®, Slim Jim®, les sauces VH®, Pogo®, Vlasic® et des marques émergentes, dont Angie's® BOOMCHICKAPOP®, Duke's®, Earth Balance®, Gardein® et Frontera®.
Nous sommes très fiers d’avoir la culture la plus influente, la plus dynamique et la plus inclusive du secteur alimentaire . Pour en savoir plus, visitez www.conagrabrands.ca .
Position summary:
The Sr Director Marketing is responsible for thought leadership in building the brand strategy for Conagra Brands Canada ensuring alignment with the international and local business plans to ensure that brand objectives meet and exceed plan objectives and key metrics. They will serve as a member of the Canadian Leadership Team, whereby they will be responsible for total Canada results. They will ensure the professional development of the brand teams and they will also be expected to build strong professional links with the U.S. and other International regions to ensure alignment and to discover opportunities to leverage.
Responsibilities:
Full brand P&L responsibility, budget management, and promotional spend
Achieve and/or over deliver on all financial objectives (top line, gross margin and bottom line)
Serve on the Canadian Leadership Team, enabling our Big Rocks strategy and driving our Head, Heart and Hand engagement results
Lead, manage, and develop key talent on the brand team
Plan and develop brand strategies for assigned pillars, selling through various distribution channels across Canada
Responsible for business planning, brand strategy and brand positioning
Drive innovative online and digital initiatives
Manage and develop trade promotions and category management initiatives
Execution of marketing programs (consumer and trade) to ensure growth of business within each channel
Drive, develop, and manage compelling marketing programs in collaboration with sales leadership
Build strong professional links with the U.S. brand/marketing organizations and other International regions to ensure alignment and to leverage resources, tools, and best practices
Qualifications, Education & Experience:
Minimum 15 years of diversified business experience with a specialization in Brand/Marketing with a minimum of 7 years at a leadership level
Experience in Snack Categories in varying channels preferred
Individual that plays in the “O” (thinks organization first, and function second)
Proven results in margin expansion, utilizes the 4Ps to drive margin expansion (understands margin drives the revenue that can then be invested back into building the brand)
Should possess excellent strategic agility, experience managing strategic initiatives and deliverables, timelines and resources, while working effectively across functions
Will have a strong voice on the Canadian Leadership team, willing to provoke different points of view, challenge the status quo, push beyond the comfort zone
Strong bias for action and results oriented with a team first mentality
Demonstrated resilience and change management skills
Forward vision on consumer trends, marketplace dynamics, marketing communication, and digital media
Worked in a matrix environment with multiple manufacturing locations and a heavy SKU mix, preferably in food or at least CPG industry.
A passionate, high-energy leader with a proven track record in building and motivating a team to deliver best-in-class results, demonstrated ability to identify and develop top brand and marketing talent.
Ability to interpret research data, trends and insights, to draw conclusions, and to understand relevant implications for business
Ability to interact with senior leadership internally or externally, influence points of view without having direct authority, and work toward consensus
Self-starter with a proven record of developing and executing change in a complex environment.
Must be able to see the big picture while concurrently being able to dig into the details in order to ensure optimum business solutions, processes and systems.
Able to accept and deal with ambiguity.
A leader of unquestionable integrity, with an intense professional will, a strong sense of self, ambition for the company not for themselves alone.
A leader known for delivering results and driving continuous improvement. Has high performance expectations for themselves and holds other accountable for results.
Disclaimer
This position description is not intended, and should not be construed to be, an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, efforts or working conditions associated with the job. It is intended, however, to be an accurate reflection of those principal job elements essential for making decisions related to job performance, employee development and compensation. As such, the incumbent may perform other duties and responsibilities as required.
SF:LI
Conagra Brands is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, or any other protected factor. ConAgra Foods is committed to working with and providing accommodation to individuals with disabilities. Title: Marketing Director, Online Casino - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Score Media and Gaming Inc. empowers millions of sports fans through its digital media and sports betting products. Its media app ‘theScore’ is one of the most popular in North America, delivering fans highly personalized live scores, news, stats, and betting information from their favorite teams, leagues, and players. The Company’s sports betting app ‘theScore Bet’ delivers an immersive and holistic mobile sports betting experience and is currently available to place wagers in New Jersey, Colorado, Iowa and Indiana. theScore also creates and distributes innovative digital content through its web, social and esports platforms.
Typical Workday at theScore:
Own the casino games catalogue, including in-app game merchandising and game release cycle
Oversee the development of all online casino marketing activities, and partner with the broader theScore Bet marketing team to execute these programs across player acquisition, cross-sell within theScore’s media and sportsbook offerings, CRM, referral, affiliate and other marketing initiatives
Establish, manage, and continuously optimize online casino promotional campaigns and bonus offers
Innovate on casino game experiences to provide a best-in-class offering
Ensure responsible gaming principles and regulatory compliance are engrained throughout all aspects of the online casino operation
Work cross-functionally with product, technology, analytics, compliance, and finance teams to execute overall company strategy and vision
Actively monitor and report on competitors’ product, strategy, and initiatives within operating environments
Contribute to product roadmap while providing feedback on quality and usability of existing and in development products/tools
Develop the go-to-market casino strategy for new market launches
Work with the VIP team to identify and create programs for high-value players
Other duties as required.
Requirements:
3-5 years experience in online casino operations and marketing, with experience in the U.S. online casino industry highly desired, social gaming experience is a plus
Data-driven, analytical mindset with strong knowledge and understanding of user journeys, CRM, and CLV
Driven self-starter who is equally comfortable taking initiative and operating autonomously as they are working within a larger team
Creative and pragmatic approach to problem solving.
What We Offer:
Competitive salary with Employee Share Purchase Plan.
Comprehensive Benefits package.
Fun, relaxed work environment.
Education and conference reimbursements.
Parental leave top up.
theScore is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability or age.

Title: Social Media Coordinator - Restigouche - Coordonnateur des médias sociaux - New Brunswick - Indeed.com
Description:
Voir ce message en français plus bas
BE a part of something BIG and here’s why…
VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITY
Relay For Life Social Media Coordinator
WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
As the Social Media Coordinator you will be responsible for:
Executing a social media campaign that promotes Relay For Life and CCS and communicates the importance of Relay within your community, driving participation and support
Using approved provincial/national materials and branding to create awareness in your immediate community via multiple social marketing platforms
Posting on all social media accounts (at minimum, Facebook)
Building the following of these social media accounts
Working with the Communication Lead to execute a social and traditional media coordinated campaign
THE CANADIAN CANCER SOCIETY
BE a part of a collective of people united by a singular focus where no Canadian fears cancer. BE bold by committing your time to driving positive change alongside families, friends, healthcare teams, donors, scientists, advocates and all those who strive to make the cancer journey one that is supported in every way.
We believe that life is bigger than cancer. We believe your support is stronger than cancer.
JOIN US and be part of the larger Relay community and have opportunity to learn and mentor as you engage with CCS staff and volunteers.
Applicants must be a minimum age of 14 years old to apply for this position.
L'utilisation
du
masculin
dans le
présent
document a pour
seul
but
d’alléger
le
texte
FAITES PARTIE
de quelque chose de GRAND
et voyez pourquoi…
OCCASION DE BÉNÉVOLAT
Coordonnateur des médias sociaux, Relais pour la vie
CE QUE VOUS FEREZ
À titre de Coordonnateur des médias sociaux, vous effectuerez les tâches suivantes :
Mettre en œuvre une campagne dans les médias sociaux pour promouvoir le Relais pour la vie et la SCC ainsi que pour communiquer l’importance du Relais dans votre milieu, de manière à favoriser la participation et le soutien des membres de la communauté
Utiliser le matériel ainsi que l’image de marque qui ont été approuvés à l’échelle provinciale ou nationale pour assurer une visibilité dans votre communauté immédiate, à partir de multiples plateformes de médias sociaux
Mettre des publications en ligne dans tous les comptes de médias sociaux (au moins sur Facebook)
Accroître l’abonnement à ces comptes de médias sociaux
Collaborer avec le Responsable des communications pour déployer une campagne coordonnée dans les médias sociaux et traditionnels
LA SOCIÉTÉ CANADIENNE DU CANCER
FAITES PARTIE d’un groupe de personnes réunies autour d’une cause commune – un monde où aucun Canadien n’aura à craindre le cancer. AGISSEZ en donnant de votre temps pour transformer positivement l’expérience du cancer de toutes les manières possibles, aux côtés de familles, d’amis, d’équipes de soins, de donateurs, de scientifiques, de militants et de tous ceux et celles qui ont le cancer à cœur.
REJOIGNEZ-NOUS
et faites partie de la grande communauté Relais et ayez l'opportunité d'apprendre et d'être un mentor en vous engageant avec le personnel et les
bénévoles
de la SCC.
Les candidats doivent être âgés d'au moins 14 ans pour postuler pour ce rôle.

Title: Project Manager – Digital Marketing - Guelph, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
WHO WE ARE
Blue North works exclusively in the social sector as a full-service fundraising agency to help nonprofits connect with donors and grow their fundraising revenue. We work with a wide variety of clients including international development, hospitals and healthcare, and missions and human services organizations across North America.
We are proud to help clients create compelling fundraising magic – and then scale it. We use data mining and insights, mass personalization tools and techniques, deep fundraising knowledge, automated communications technology and multiple channels to deliver the right messages to the right people at the right time. We are passionate about our clients’ work and the good they want to achieve.
About the role:
Reporting to the Director of Delivery, the Digital Marketing Project Manager will be responsible for leading and managing the deliverables of digital campaigns at Blue North. In this new role, the successful incumbent will create and implement processes, identify tools to run digital projects effectively and efficiently and oversee all aspects of digital projects to ensure high quality standards are met.
What you’ll do in the role:
> Oversee the planning, budgeting, managing and execution of digital campaigns to produce high quality products in a timely, cost-effective manner
> Monitor progress and budgets to provide regular status updates and reports to Director and other key stakeholders
> Anticipate and proactively communicate deviations from the plan as well as potential issues and risks; take appropriate correction action when necessary
> Work with team members to create timelines and schedules, use appropriate tools to manage team and tasks, plan activities and negotiate consensus on the appointed tasks
> Provide direction, feedback, leadership and coaching to team members to achieve success
> Create structures for project documentation and project assets and ensure comprehension and compliance from team members
> Perform topline analyses and identify opportunities to improve client campaigns
> Maintain monthly billing projections, cross-reference against actual costs and assist in the preparation of monthly invoices for clients
> Manage and coordinate work completed by freelancers
> Provide recommendations for improvements and develop efficiencies wherever possible
You bring to the role:
> 5 years’ experience managing digital projects which includes digital media, email and landing page development
> High proficiency with project management tools including Workamajig and Basec& experience implementing new project management tools would be considered an asset
> Strong understanding of relevant project management methodologies, processes and standards to monitor and ensure compliance
> Experience using Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager is required
> Strong working knowledge of Facebook Ads Manager, Google Ad Words/Ad Manager and other digital media platforms
> Excellent organizational skills with a proven track record of meeting deadlines and managing competing priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven and detail-oriented environment
> Highly motivated with a high level of initiative to work independently and solve problems creatively
> Effective communication skills with the ability to work with a variety of creative professionals
As we grow, Blue North Strategies is committed to creating an environment where employees feel included, valued and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to do our best work and help our clients take on the world. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and encourage applications from all qualified applicants. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation at any phase of the application or recruitment process, please let the HR representative know.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Additional pay:
Bonus pay
Benefits:
Casual dress
Company events
Dental care
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Flexible schedule
On-site parking
Paid time off
RRSP match
Work from home
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday
Experience:
project management: 5 years (preferred)
digital campaign: 5 years (preferred)
Work remotely:
Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Marketing Assistant - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Someone that can manage our online presence. (i.e. websites using WordPress, LinkedIn, Twitter, YouTube, Twitch, Instagram, Tik Tok, Younow, and Facebook).
Develop and implement digital marketing strategies and provide oversight in the evaluation of marketing programs.
Manage and optimize Google AdWords, Facebook Ads, marketing campaigns, and Video campaigns using A/B testing, keyword bid management, long tail key words
Increase click through rates, reduce cost per click and decrease average cost of acquisition of leads

Title: Chief Marketing Officer - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Who we are:
PlanetRate Inc . (https://planetrate.com) is a new start-up based on a revolutionary and transformative platform for ratings and reviews. It allows people to provide feedback on specific topics and helps businesses to understand their customers. The platform is currently translated in French, English and Romanian languages and is a portal to more than 2.7 million cities and over 250 countries.
Opportunity:
We are expanding our leadership team with the addition of a talented Chief Marketing Officer. Reporting to the CEO, the ideal candidate will be an experienced and entrepreneurial marketing leader with a proven track record driving and accelerating revenue growth through customer acquisition, engagement and retention. This high influence, high impact role will have the responsibility of integrating into our Agile environment and leading all marketing efforts across PlanetRate.com.
The Chief Marketing Officer will be analytical, data-driven, creative, and collaborative. They will be relentless about understanding and meeting the needs of customers. Their role is both strategic and operational with several key initiatives happening simultaneously and moving at a fast pace. We need someone who has the capability and willingness to roll up their sleeves, as well as provide vision.
A strong desire to contribute immediately as well as build future capability is essential.
This is a position that is not initially paid with a salary but with a generous equity award component (which will be very valuable, eventually as we see this company being very successful either as a standalone or a valuable acquisition target by a large company, more established company in one of the several markets this platform will aggressively compete and grab significant market share from). Our philosophy is that we are all motivated more if we enjoy what we do — which is why hours are flexible and may involve working remotely — and personally share in the company’s success.
This is a one-of-a-kind opportunity to get in at the ground floor and join a fast-growing startup. If this sounds challenging, exciting and fun, we want to talk to you.
Ideal Candidate / Job Specifics:
Report directly to the CEO
Oversee and execute strategy on company marketing initiatives that contribute to our high growth goals, including demand generation, customer acquisition, marketing operations, content, events, social media, PR, branding, and more.
Collaborate with leadership team and key stakeholders across the organization to define priority marketing strategies and align them with product roadmap, sales initiatives, and the overall growth strategy of the business.
Represent PlanetRate at industry conferences, trade shows and other events.
Understand what drives market interest and market dynamics and translate these into actionable strategy and tactics.
Develop, test, and scale high ROI digital marketing campaigns across email, SEO, SEM, and social.
Manage and report on marketing metrics (Google Analytics, Brand Awareness, Email response rate, Lead conversion etc.).
Drive conversion of prospective consumers to active customers through funnel optimization including creative, segmentation/targeting, and landing pages.
Oversee the company’s brand strategy.
Exercise a data-centric approach to gather customer/user insights and use data to improve future marketing campaigns and results.
Implement a product marketing team to ensure alignment on all new product feature announcements, launches, and sales/marketing collateral.
Attract, retain, and develop talent. Establish expectations and create an environment which supports and enables high-performance by both teams and individuals.
Skills & Experience:
​​
Experience in a fast growing, consumer-focused business required.
Technology background strongly preferred.
Experience working in an Agile environment strongly preferred.
Digital marketing experience required including expertise in analytics, A/B and multivariate testing, LTV modeling, etc
Experience driving growth with innovative prospecting and demand generation campaigns at scale from first impression through landing page required.
Experience identifying target audiences, working with customer segmentation and personalization, and creating campaign strategies required.
Experience with branding strategies and marcom preferred.
Experience leading a team.
Demonstrated experience in growing new businesses as well as developing effective and efficient strategies and business plans for all marketing aspects.
Qualifications:
Energetic and passionate
Highly analytical and data-driven
Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to lead and inspire teams and individuals
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced working environment
Why work for PlanetRate?
Help consumers make informative decisions before any purchase
Enjoy a fun, casual and collaborative working environment
Help guide company decisions and direction
See results of your work in days, not years
Work with other talented and passionate team members

Title: Marketing Manager, Home Entertainment (HE) - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
As an industry expert, the Home Entertainment (HE) Marketing Manager is responsible for developing and implementing the division’s marketing strategy in order to further enhance LG TV and Audio brand awareness in Canada while supporting the company’s short and long-term financial objectives.
PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Brand Leadership & Execution
Further elevate LG’s brand profile within the Home Electronics industry in Canada.
Effectively market LG’s Home Entertainment television and audio products to defined target segments.
Develop plans to leverage existing or potential opportunity Partnerships consistent with the LG Home Entertainment brand.
Work with the senior management team to develop and execute marketing strategies, tactics and plans for the business to increase revenues and market share.
Execute an annual marketing plan designed to increase revenues and market share.
Ensure all product touch-points (digital and traditional) to the consumer are consistent with the company’s corporate guidelines and brand position.
Create a branding strategy that leverages the core strengths of the brand while positioning it for future growth.
Oversee production of creative content.
Trade Marketing
Direct co-branded marketing programs with Dealers.
Build relationships with Dealers to develop and amplify marketing campaigns.
Provide final approval on all co-branded creative assets.
Complete store visits on a monthly basis.
Relationship Management
Effectively manage Advertising, Media, and Research agency relationships in order to ensure brand and message alignment and timely execution of initiatives.
Succinct completion of Advertising, Media, and Research agency briefings with the support of other internal stakeholders in order to ensure the campaign purpose, target customers, timelines and expected results are commonly understood.
Work with Product Managers to understand and align on new product launch objectives.
Collaborate with in-store marketing manager and LG’s Corporate Marketing teams to develop both traditional and digital marketing materials that consistently support LG’s competitive HE positioning.
Planning
Own the annual Home Entertainment marketing budget process.
Set, track and report on marketing performance metrics that demonstrate marketing ROI and customer engagement.
Collaborate and develop direct marketing communications content.
Collaborate and develop activities related to advertising, public relations, sponsorships, tradeshows and sales support.
Direct product launches including marketing messages, product reviews and article placements.
Analysis
Gather relevant data for customer segments and actively monitor and analyze this data to refine marketing strategy and generate consumer insights.
Management of budget and processing of invoices on a monthly basis.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Undergraduate degree & a minimum of 3-5 years of brand management experience with demonstrated record of positive business results.
Prior experience managing and energizing a broad range of advertising, media, promotion and Public Relations agencies.
Consumer marketing experience, specifically in the areas of targeting, brand strategy and positioning, concept development and testing, marketing plan development, execution and post-analysis, testing, evaluating and advocating breakthrough new marketing programs.
Expert-level Digital marketing capabilities in areas including web and SEO, eComm, social and eCRM.
Strong relationship management skills, both internal and external, including the ability to respond effectively to the most sensitive inquiries or complaints.
Strong analytical skills in applying principles of logic or scientific thinking, including advanced mathematical concepts, to a wide range of intellectual and practical problems.
Superior language skills in making effective and persuasive speeches and presentations on controversial or complex topics to senior management, board of directors and other entities.
Ability to pivot quickly in response to changing market dynamics and competitive activities.
Ability to prioritize multiple product categories within the business.
The ability to professionally grow into broader responsibilities.
History of presenting a fresh perspective to existing industries and products.
Sound knowledge of the Canadian Home Electronics industry
Note:
This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.
LG Electronics Canada Inc., is an Equal Opportunity Employer. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), and the Ontario Human Rights Code, LG Electronics Canada Inc., will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform LG’s Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation

Title: Marketing Manager - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Marketing Manager :
Cultures, Villa Madina, Mr. Souvlaki, Extreme Pita and Vanellis.
Reporting to the Director of Marketing, the Marketing Manager will play an integral role in the planning and execution of marketing activities for 5 brands in the MTY Group family: Cultures, Villa Madina, Mr. Souvlaki, Extreme Pita and Vanellis.
Benefits include:
Casual business attire workplace
Work from home flexibility with post-pandemic “team office” days
Standard company health and dental plans
Employee Assistance program with access to a wide range of services spanning across mental health to legal and financial coaching.
Employee Profit Sharing Plan with matching employer contributions
Summer Hours
Financial reimbursement for professional order costs and continuing education requirements
Monthly company wide recognition awards with quarterly and yearly winners
Social corporate events including but not limited to webinars, quarterly town halls and fun activities for all
Free office parking
Key Responsibilities: (includes but not limited to)
Grow & improve our digital presence
o Drive consistency across digital platforms including social channels, email marketing, web and mobile app
o Work with our agency partners on digital campaigns (including influencer and paid media campaigns across several channels)
o Increase discoverability on local search
Build our brand loyalty programs to be a core sales driving tool
o Assist in planning and executing programs to build our loyalty database and achieve key growth targets
o Report regularly on results and create buy in with franchisees at the store level
Grow & optimize e-commerce platforms
o Work with 3rd party partners to optimize sales (increase basket size, repeat customers)
o Assist in developing strategy to launch/grow white label ordering platform
Contribute to the development of strategic initiatives and annual marketing plans
Lead the execution of marketing materials to support national promotions
Support our franchisees by planning and executing local store marketing
About you:
Pro-active and takes initiative, leveraging and learning from the successes and c hallenges of each project/campaign
Thrives on wearing multiple hats to drive results
A problem solver, using both data and creative thinking
Excellent project management skills and can manage multiple priorities
Very strong English communication skills, both verbal and written
On the pulse of social and digital trends
Requirements:
Post secondary degree in Marketing or Business and a minimum of 3-5 years of relevant marketing experience
Experience working in the food industry or franchise environment an asset
Experience managing digital marketing campaigns an asset
Bilingual (French, written and verbal) a strong asset
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office
About MTY Group
MTY Food Group inc. one of the largest franchisors in Canada’s restaurant industry with over 75 brands. Operating over 7000 locations worldwide, the multitude of flavours of its many brands allows MTY to satisfy the different tastes and needs of consumers every day.
MTY is known for its entrepreneurial spirit which was built on the principles of excellence, dedication, and innovation. The rhythm is fast to support the changing pace of the food industry and the needs of our business partners.
For over 40 years, it has been increasing its presence by delivering new concepts and making acquisitions and strategic alliances that have allowed MTY Group to reach new heights year after year.
